content.raw: The first step to fixing this is moving away from the ros visualization dependency. Which means we need to implement GLSL shaders for heightmaps.
content.html: The first step to fixing this is moving away from the ros visualization dependency. Which means we need to implement GLSL shaders for heightmaps.

content.raw: I would say that i can work without terrain support but, i can't with segfault at startup.
content.html: I would say that i can work without terrain support but, i can't with segfault at startup.

content.raw:
Hi Konrad,

did you turn off 3D effects to see if this helps?  (install gnome-session-fallback and select gnome 2D without effects when logging int).

Check out [my experimentation with intel gpu start-up issue](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/f998b9ac61ebedfabea38b589f60b32d30d9f00d/?at=testing_intel_render), there with intel the intermittent error could be avoided by doing some additional checks.

John
content.html:
Hi Konrad,

did you turn off 3D effects to see if this helps? (install gnome-session-fallback and select gnome 2D without effects when logging int).

Check out my experimentation with intel gpu start-up issue, there with intel the intermittent error could be avoided by doing some additional checks.

John

content.raw:
A lot has changed between rendering calls in gazebo 1.0 and 1.2 , any chance we can narrow it down?

Also, if rendering is not available, shouldn't gazebo start without rendering rather than segfault?
content.html:
A lot has changed between rendering calls in gazebo 1.0 and 1.2 , any chance we can narrow it down?

Also, if rendering is not available, shouldn't gazebo start without rendering rather than segfault?

content.raw:
Disableing effects in gnome doesn't help.
The SEGFAUT happen during loading GLSL shader, so it looks like a problem with shaders.
After some debbuging i found that the problem is in the shader which is used for sky rendering.
When i removed line 1147: this->renderTarget->addListener(this->GetScene()->skyx); from Camera.cc gazebo start without segfault.
content.html: Disableing effects in gnome doesn't help. The SEGFAUT happen during loading GLSL shader, so it looks like a problem with shaders. After some debbuging i found that the problem is in the shader which is used for sky rendering. When i removed line 1147: this->renderTarget->addListener(this->GetScene()->skyx); from Camera.cc gazebo start without segfault.

content.raw: is there a way to disable sky effects without change source code?
content.html: is there a way to disable sky effects without change source code?

content.raw: There is no option for setting sky efects. Sky effect are initialized in Scene::Init() in line 254: this->SetSky(); I think that sky effects should be disabled by default, and should be enabled in world file when needed.
content.html: There is no option for setting sky efects. Sky effect are initialized in Scene::Init() in line 254: this->SetSky(); I think that sky effects should be disabled by default, and should be enabled in world file when needed.

content.raw: Enable sky effects only if <sky> tag exist in sdf.
content.html: Enable sky effects only if <sky> tag exist in sdf.

content.raw:
Hi Konrad,
Thanks for the patch.  With this patch, is sky re-enabled if `<sky>` tag exists?  And is it necessary to turn off deferred shading?
John
content.html: Hi Konrad, Thanks for the patch. With this patch, is sky re-enabled if <sky> tag exists? And is it necessary to turn off deferred shading? John

content.raw:
Sorry my workspace was not as clena as i thought.
It should not touch deferred shading.

Yes it enable sky if "<sky>" tag exist.

http://gazebosim.org

Msg Publicized address: 192.168.1.45
Error [RenderEngine.cc:607] Can't open display: 
Warning [RenderEngine.cc:86] Unable to create X window. Rendering will be disabled
~~~
